params.current: the address of the new access-control contract
params.old: the address prior to the current setting

params.accountingGas: gas overhead incurred by accounting logic
params.maximumGasPriceGwei: highest gas price for which transmitter will be compensated
params.observationPaymentGjuels: reward to oracle for contributing an observation to a successfully transmitted report
params.reasonableGasPriceGwei: transmitter will receive reward for gas prices under this value
params.transmissionPaymentGjuels: reward to transmitter of a successful report

params.configCount: ordinal number of this config setting among all config settings over the life of this contract
params.f: maximum number of faulty/dishonest oracles the protocol can tolerate while still working correctly
params.offchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the oracles exclusively and only passed through the contract
params.offchainConfigVersion: version of the serialization format used for "offchainConfig" parameter
params.onchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the contract (and possibly oracles)
params.previousConfigBlockNumber: block in which the previous config was set, to simplify historic analysis
params.signers: ith element is address ith oracle uses to sign a report
params.transmitters: ith element is address ith oracle uses to transmit a report via the transmit method

params.aggregatorRoundId: the round to which this report was assigned
params.answer: median of the observations attached to this report
params.epochAndRound: least-significant byte is the OCR protocol round number, the other bytes give the big-endian OCR protocol epoch number
params.juelsPerFeeCoin: exchange rate between feeCoin (e.g. ETH on Ethereum) and LINK, denominated in juels
params.observers: i-th element is the oracle id of the oracle that made the i-th observation
params.transmitter: address from which the report was transmitted

params.linkToken: address of the LINK token contract
params.payee: address to which the payment is sent
params.transmitter: address from which the oracle sends reports to the transmit method

params.current: the payee address for the oracle, prior to this setting
params.proposed: the proposed new payee address for the oracle
params.transmitter: address from which the oracle sends reports to the transmit method

params.current: the payee address for the oracle, prior to this setting
params.transmitter: address from which the oracle sends reports to the transmit method

params.current: the address of the new access controller contract
params.old: the address prior to the current setting

params.currentGasLimit: current gas limit for validate calls
params.previousGasLimit: previous gas limit for validate calls

acceptPayeeship(address).details: can only be called by proposed new payee address

params.transmitter: transmitter address of oracle whose payee is changing

params.roundId: the aggregator round of the target report

params.accountingGas: gas overhead of the accounting logic
params.maximumGasPriceGwei: highest gas price for which transmitter will be compensated
params.observationPaymentGjuels: reward to oracle for contributing an observation to a successfully transmitted report
params.reasonableGasPriceGwei: transmitter will receive reward for gas prices under this value
params.transmissionPaymentGjuels: reward to transmitter of a successful report

params.roundId: target aggregator round (NOT OCR round). Must fit in uint32

returns.answer: median of report from given roundId
returns.startedAt: timestamp of when observations were made offchain
returns.updatedAt: timestamp of block in which report from given roundId was transmitted

params.roundId: aggregator round (NOT OCR round) of target report

getTransmitters().details: The list will match the order used to specify the transmitter during setConfig

returns._0: list of addresses permitted to transmit reports to this contract

returns.blockNumber: block at which this config was set
returns.configCount: ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far

returns.scanLogs: indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead.

returns.roundId: aggregator round of latest report (NOT OCR round)
returns.startedAt: timestamp of when observations were made offchain
returns.updatedAt: timestamp of block containing latest report

returns.configDigest: domain separation tag for the latest report
returns.epoch: epoch in which the latest report was generated
returns.latestTimestamp_: when the latest report was transmitted
returns.round: OCR round in which the latest report was generated

returns.availableBalance: LINK available on this contract, after accounting for outstanding obligations. can become negative

params.transmitterAddress: address used by oracle for signing or transmitting reports
the transmitter address of the oracle

returns._0: the aggregatorRoundId of the next round. Note: The report for this round may have been transmitted (but not yet mined) *before* requestNewRound() was even called. There is *no* guarantee of causality between the request and the report at aggregatorRoundId.

params.accountingGas: gas overhead incurred by accounting logic
params.maximumGasPriceGwei: highest gas price for which transmitter will be compensated
params.observationPaymentGjuels: reward to oracle for contributing an observation to a successfully transmitted report
params.reasonableGasPriceGwei: transmitter will receive reward for gas prices under this value
params.transmissionPaymentGjuels: reward to transmitter of a successful report

params.f: number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate
params.offchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the oracles exclusively and only passed through the contract
params.onchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the contract (and possibly oracles)
params.signers: addresses with which oracles sign the reports
params.transmitters: addresses oracles use to transmit the reports

setLinkToken(address,address).details: this function will return early (without an error) without changing any state if linkToken equals getLinkToken().this will trigger a payout so that a malicious owner cannot take from oracles what is already owed to them.we assume that the token contract is correct. This contract is not written to handle misbehaving ERC20 tokens!

params.linkToken: the address of the LINK token contract
params.recipient: remaining funds from the previous token contract are transferred here

setPayees(address[],address[]).details: must be called by ownercannot be used to change payee addresses, only to initially populate them

params.payees: addresses of payees corresponding to list of transmitters
params.transmitters: addresses oracles use to transmit the reports

params.requesterAccessController: designates the address of the new requester access controller

setValidatorConfig(address,uint32).details: set newValidator to 0x0 to disable validate calls

params.newGasLimit: new gas limit for validate calls
params.newValidator: address of the new validator contract

transferPayeeship(address,address).details: can only be called by payee address

params.transmitter: transmitter address of oracle whose payee is changing

params.rawVs: ith element is the the V component of the ith signature
params.report: serialized report, which the signatures are signing
params.reportContext: serialized report context containing configDigest, epoch, round, extraHash
params.rs: ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries
params.ss: ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries

params.amount: maximum amount to withdraw, denominated in LINK-wei.

withdrawPayment(address).details: must be called by oracle's payee address

params.transmitter: the transmitter address of the oracle

BillingAccessControllerSet(address,addre.notice: emitted when a new access-control contract is set

BillingSet(uint32,uint32,uint32,uint32,u.notice: emitted when billing parameters are set

ConfigSet(uint32,bytes32,uint64,address[.notice: triggers a new run of the offchain reporting protocol

NewTransmission(uint32,int192,address,ui.notice: indicates that a new report was transmitted

OraclePaid(address,address,uint256,addre.notice: emitted when an oracle has been paid LINK

PayeeshipTransferRequested(address,addre.notice: emitted when a transfer of an oracle's payee address has been initiated

PayeeshipTransferred(address,address,add.notice: emitted when a transfer of an oracle's payee address has been completed

RequesterAccessControllerSet(address,add.notice: emitted when a new requester access controller contract is set

RoundRequested(address,bytes32,uint32,ui.notice: emitted to immediately request a new round

Transmitted(bytes32,uint32).notice: optionally emitted to indicate the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may use latestConfigDigestAndEpoch with scanLogs set to false.

ValidatorConfigSet(address,uint32,addres.notice: indicates that the validator configuration has been set

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

acceptPayeeship(address).notice: second step of payeeship transfer (safe transfer pattern)

addAccess(address).notice: Adds an address to the access list

description().notice: human-readable description of observable this contract is reporting on

getAnswer(uint256).notice: median of report from given aggregator round (NOT OCR round)

getRequesterAccessController().notice: address of the requester access controller contract

getRoundData(uint80).notice: details for the given aggregator round

getTimestamp(uint256).notice: timestamp of block in which report from given aggregator round was transmitted

hasAccess(address,bytes).notice: Returns the access of an address

latestAnswer().notice: median from the most recent report

latestConfigDetails().notice: information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration

latestConfigDigestAndEpoch().notice: optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may return scanLogs set to true and use Transmitted events to provide this information to offchain watchers.

latestRound().notice: Aggregator round (NOT OCR round) in which last report was transmitted

latestRoundData().notice: aggregator details for the most recently transmitted report

latestTimestamp().notice: timestamp of block in which last report was transmitted

latestTransmissionDetails().notice: details about the most recent report

linkAvailableForPayment().notice: allows oracles to check that sufficient LINK balance is available

oracleObservationCount(address).notice: number of observations oracle is due to be reimbursed for

owedPayment(address).notice: query an oracle's payment amount, denominated in juels

removeAccess(address).notice: Removes an address from the access list

setConfig(address[],address[],uint8,byte.notice: sets offchain reporting protocol configuration incl. participating oracles

setLinkToken(address,address).notice: sets the LINK token contract used for paying oracles

setPayees(address[],address[]).notice: sets the payees for transmitting addresses

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

transferPayeeship(address,address).notice: first step of payeeship transfer (safe transfer pattern)

transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],byte.notice: transmit is called to post a new report to the contract

withdrawFunds(address,uint256).notice: withdraw any available funds left in the contract, up to amount, after accounting for the funds due to participants in past reports

withdrawPayment(address).notice: withdraws an oracle's payment from the contract

userdoc.notice: Wrapper of OCR2Aggregator which checks read access on Aggregator-interface methods
